00054 void NTee::childExited( int sig )
00055 {
00056    int status;
00057    pid_t pid = wait(&status);
00058    
00059    int exitWith = WEXITSTATUS(status);
00060    std::cout << "R client: " << pid << " has exited: " << exitWith << "\n";
00061    
00062    // We can't shutdown the Lsock_ socket, even though we know that the R
00063    // side won't be communicating anymore, because there still could be stuff
00064    // left on the R socket to read... and send.  But it should be returning
00065    // EOF real soon.
00066    
00067    // returns control to where we were.  If we are in a read, it will have
00068    // to handle EINTR errno.
00069 }

00084 void NTee::startChildProc() {
00085 
00086    //** Replace any @NTEEPORT values in R_cmd with the actual port number
00087    char** ptr = &s_.R_cmd[1];
00088    while( *ptr ) {
00089       if ( strcmp( *ptr, "@NTEEPORT" ) == 0 )
00090          snprintf( *ptr, 9,"%d",srvPort_);
00091       else if ( strcmp( *ptr, "@NTEESERVERHOSTADDR" ) == 0 )
00092          snprintf( *ptr, 19, serverip_.c_str());
00093       else if ( strcmp( *ptr, "@NTEESERVERHOSTNAME" ) == 0 )
00094          snprintf( *ptr, 19, serverhost_.c_str());
00095 
00096       ++ptr;
00097    }
00098 
00099    //** Start the client.
00100    pid_t pid;
00101    if ( (pid=fork()) == 0 ) {
00102       // in the child.
00103       SysErrIf( execvp( s_.R_cmd[0], s_.R_cmd ) == -1 );
00104    }
00105    SysErrIf( pid == -1 ).info("Unable to fork properly\n");
00106    
00107    //** trap the SIGCHLD which will be queued to us if the client dies and
00108    //** cause the program to collect the child process with wait.
00109    UnixSignalHub::trap(SIGCHLD, boost::bind( &NTee::childExited, this, _1 ));
00110 }

00122 int NTee::constructService( sockaddr_in* psa, socklen_t* plen )
00123 {
00124    int sock;
00125    int type = (s_.protocol==Settings::TCP)? SOCK_STREAM : SOCK_DGRAM;   
00126    SysErrIf( (sock=socket(AF_INET, type, 0 )) == -1 );
00127 
00128    // Here we set the close-on-exec flag for the socket, because we don't want
00129    // it to carry over to the client process.
00130    SysErrIf( fcntl( sock, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC ) == -1 );
00131    
00132    // Set up the internet address and port 
00133    memset( psa, 0, *plen);
00134    psa->sin_family = AF_INET;
00135    psa->sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
00136    psa->sin_port = htons(s_.srv_port);  // 0 is the wildcard port
00137    SysErrIf( bind(sock, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(psa),
00138                   *plen) == -1);
00139 
00140    // Get values for whatever the kernel decided to bind us to.
00141    SysErrIf( getsockname(sock, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(psa),
00142                          plen) == -1 );
00143 
00144    //** Save the server port that was assigned and the host address  
00145    srvPort_ = ntohs(psa->sin_port);
00146 
00147    char buf[NI_MAXHOST];
00148    SysErrIf( gethostname( buf, sizeof(buf)) );
00149    std::cout << "Server on: " << buf 
00150              << ":" << ntohs(psa->sin_port) << "\n"; 
00151    serverhost_.assign(buf);
00152       
00153    SysErrIf( inet_ntop(AF_INET, psa, buf, *plen) == 0 );
00154    serverip_.assign(buf);
00155    
00156 
00157    
00158    // magic # 5 is just what most examples use.
00159    SysErrIf( listen(sock,5) == -1 );
00160    
00161    return sock;
00162 }

00171 void NTee::startListening()
00172 {
00173    int rc=0;
00174    fd_set rd_fds;
00175    int max = std::max(Lsock_,Rsock_);
00176 
00177    // force both L and R sockets to be non-blocking IO.
00178    fcntl(Lsock_, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00179    fcntl(Rsock_, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00180       
00181    FD_ZERO(&rd_fds);
00182    FD_SET(Lsock_, &rd_fds);
00183    FD_SET(Rsock_, &rd_fds);
00184    
00185    std::string msg;
00186    std::cout << "Polling\n";
00187    char buf[1024];
00188    
00189    try_again:
00190    while( (rc=select(max+1, &rd_fds, 0, 0, 0)) > 0 ) {
00191       std::cout << "Select returned: " << rc << "\n";
00192          
00193       if ( FD_ISSET( Lsock_, &rd_fds ) )
00194          transfer(Lsock_,Rsock_);
00195          
00196       if ( FD_ISSET( Rsock_, &rd_fds ) )
00197          transfer(Rsock_,Lsock_);
00198       
00199       FD_ZERO(&rd_fds);
00200       FD_SET(Lsock_, &rd_fds);
00201       FD_SET(Rsock_, &rd_fds);
00202       
00203    }
00204    if ( rc == -1 && errno == EINTR ) {
00205       goto try_again;    // SIGCHLD came in, but there could be still some
00206                          // data left to read. Goto's are bad form, but here
00207                          // we get a lot less code for using it.
00208    }
00209    
00210 }

00223 void NTee::transfer( const Socket& from, const Socket& to )
00224 {
00225    char* buf = 0;
00226    size_t len = read_n( from, &buf );
00227    boost::shared_ptr<char> ptr( buf, free );
00228 
00229    std::cout << "Reading from " << from << " --> " 
00230              << to << " (" << len << ")\n";
00231    if ( len > 0 )
00232       write_n( to, buf, len );
00233    else
00234       close(from);
00235 
00236    alertRecorders(from, to, buf, len);
00237 }

00255 void NTee::alertRecorders(const Socket& from, const Socket& to, 
00256                           const char* buf, 
00257                           size_t len)
00258 {
00259    RecCont_t::iterator iter= recorders_.begin();
00260    for( ; iter != recorders_.end(); ++iter ) {
00261       (*iter)->record(from, to, buf, len);
00262    }
00263 }

00280 int NTee::start()
00281 {
00282    //** Build up the service port.
00283    sockaddr_in addr;
00284    socklen_t len = sizeof(addr);
00285    Socket sock;
00286    sock = constructService( &addr, &len );
00287    
00288    //** Not going to accept yet! Instead, we start the client.
00289    startChildProc();
00290          
00291    // Back in the parent (ntee) otherwise we'd have exited.
00292    SysErrIf( (Rsock_=accept(sock, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr),
00293                              &len)) == -1 );
00294       
00295    // Report the client connection.
00296    char buf[INET_ADDRSTRLEN];
00297    inet_ntop(AF_INET, &addr, buf, sizeof(addr));   
00298    std::cout << "Client connection: " << buf
00299              << ":" << ntohs(addr.sin_port) << "\n";
00300    
00301    //** R process has connected... time to connect to the L process.
00302    int type = (s_.protocol==Settings::TCP)? SOCK_STREAM : SOCK_DGRAM;   
00303    SysErrIf( (Lsock_=socket(AF_INET, type, 0 )) == -1 );
00304 
00305    // Set up the internet address and port 
00306    memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
00307    struct addrinfo* pAddrInfo;
00308    struct addrinfo hints;
00309    memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
00310    hints.ai_family = AF_INET;
00311    hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00312     
00313    int err = 0;
00314    SysErrIf( (err=getaddrinfo(s_.L_host_ip.c_str(), s_.L_port.c_str(),
00315                               &hints, &pAddrInfo)) != 0 )
00316            .info("%s? %d:%s\n",s_.L_host_ip.c_str(),err,gai_strerror(err));
00317            
00318    SysErrIf( connect(Lsock_, pAddrInfo->ai_addr,
00319                      pAddrInfo->ai_addrlen) == -1 );
00320                        
00321    std::cout << "NTee connected to L side: " << s_.L_host_ip << ":"
00322              << s_.L_port << "\n";
00323    
00324    // free the address info structure alloced by getaddrinfo()
00325    freeaddrinfo(pAddrInfo);
00326    
00327    //** Start listening to both sides and passing the information.
00328    startListening();
00329    
00330    //** shut down all recorders
00331    std::for_each( recorders_.begin(), recorders_.end(),
00332                   boost::bind(&Recorder::shutdown, _1));
00333    
00334    return 0;
00335 }

00348 void NTee::addRecorder( const boost::shared_ptr<Recorder>& r )
00349 {
00350    recorders_.push_back( r );
00351 }
